pos_mean_info_list.mean: 细菌学的，[微] 细菌学上的
[生化] 溶菌作用；细菌分解处理

word_mean_info__list.difference: (系bacterium的复数形式)，泛指任何在动植物体中广泛传播的微生物细菌，其中有的对生命体无害，有的能导致传染病或严重疾病，如天花、霍乱等。
微生物的俗称，专指引起人体生命的病菌。
技术用语，特指病毒或过滤性病原体。
非正式用词，指细菌或由病毒所引起的传染病。
本义指在显微镜下才能见到的微生物，现在多指引起疾病的细菌。

word_group.brief_definition: 致病菌；病原细菌；病原菌

bilingual.source: The housefly is a carrier of bacteria.

bilingual.target: 细菌可以通过空气传导。
许多疾病是由细菌引起的。

bilingual.source: He used a microscope to observe bacteria.

bilingual.target: 质粒可以在细菌之间转移。
结痂保护伤口免受细菌侵害。

list.abstract: 《BACTERIA》是idHe演唱的歌曲，于2004年4月28日发行，收录于《KING OF PSYBORG ROCK STAR》专辑中。

yingyinNormal.en: They still behave a bit like bacteria.
yingyinNormal.zh: 它们的习性依然与细菌有些许相似之处。

yingyinNormal.en: The purple bacteria live by harnessing energy from the sun.
yingyinNormal.zh: 这种紫色的细菌依靠吸收太阳的能量而生长。

yingyinNormal.en: Friction also plays a key role in the removal of bacteria, with much of it being transferred right onto the paper towel.
yingyinNormal.zh: 摩擦力在去除细菌时也是个重要的因素，细菌可以立刻转移到纸巾上。

yingyinNormal.en: Hot air blowers are incubators and spewers of bacteria and pestilence.
yingyinNormal.zh: 吹风机可以说是细菌和瘟疫的发源地。

yingyinNormal.en: And over time, down there, a different type of bacteria evolved.
yingyinNormal.zh: 在水体深处，通过经年累月的进化，细菌中的新物种出现了。

yingyinNormal.en: These are hallow bacteria and they didn't just occupy the occasional lake.
yingyinNormal.zh: 我们应该膜拜这些细菌，它们并非只是随性地在这个湖中安家落户。

yingyinNormal.en: Inside every leaf of every plant on the planet are the direct descendants of those first green bacteria.
yingyinNormal.zh: 地球上每株植物的每片叶子之中，都排满了绿细菌鼻祖的直系后代。

yingyinNormal.en: Over time these green bacteria, a type of Cyanobacteria, came to dominate the waters of the world.
yingyinNormal.zh: 久而久之，这些绿细菌，亦即蓝绿藻中的一种逐渐主宰了这个世界上所有的江河湖海。

yingyinNormal.en: They had to live off the colors of light left over. This made them appear green. These were the green bacteria.
yingyinNormal.zh: 它们只能依靠水体深处残存的光线生存，而这使得它们呈绿色，这就是绿细菌。

yingyinNormal.en: Every living thing on Earth is made of cells, from the smallest one-celled bacteria to the giant blue whale to you.
yingyinNormal.zh: 地球上所有的生命都是由细胞组成的，从最小的单细胞细菌，到巨大的蓝鲸，到你。

yingyinNormal.en: Well, you'll be happy to know that if you wash your hands properly with soap, nearly all traces of bacteria will be removed, regardless of how you dry them.
yingyinNormal.zh: 其实无论你怎么擦干手，只要用肥皂洗手，几乎细菌就会一干二净。

yingyinNormal.en: Conversely, some studies have shown that hand dryers may actually emit bacteria in their flow, because of the contaminated air from the bathroom.
yingyinNormal.zh: 相反的，有些研究显示，因为厕所受污染的空气，烘手机吹出来的风其实是有细菌的。

yingyinNormal.en: What is the most resilient parasite? A bacteria? A virus? An intestinal worm? An idea. Resilient. Highly contagious.
yingyinNormal.zh: 世上适应力最强的附寄物是什么？细菌? 病毒? 蛔虫？意识，生生不息 极易感染 其据脑海 安能根绝。

yingyinNormal.en: Oh, no. That movie has melting faces. It reminds me too much of the time I dropped that vial of flesh-eating bacteria into the Rhesus monkey lab.
yingyinNormal.zh: 不去了，那部片子里有熔化的人脸，总是会让我想起我上次把一小瓶食肉细菌掉在恒河猴实验室的情景。

yingyinNormal.en: Complete loss of pressure boiled off most of the water. Any bacteria that survived died in the subzero temperatures when exposed to Mar's atmosphere.
yingyinNormal.zh: 完全失压，大部分水都沸腾掉了，之前活下来的细菌都在零下温度中死掉了，暴露在火星的大气里就会这样。

yingyinNormal.en: After all, the spread of bacteria is more likely to occur with wet skin and rubbing your wet hands on your clothes or touching the bathroom door can often contaminate them even more.
yingyinNormal.zh: 毕竟，在湿皮肤上，细菌容易传播手湿湿的擦在衣服上，或者去握厕所把手，只会使手更脏。

yingyinNormal.en: This seemingly arbitrary event, bacteria absorbing one color of light rather than another, would have colossal repercussions for the planet.
yingyinNormal.zh: 这看上去显得非常偶然的演化过程，即细菌碰巧吸收了这种颜色的光线而非其他颜色的光线却间接地对地球产生了极为重大的影响。

yingyinNormal.en: You have a slight epidermal abrasion on your forearm. I suggest an anti-bacteria spray.
yingyinNormal.zh: 你的小臂有轻微的上皮组织擦伤，我建议进行除菌喷雾处理。

direction_info.description:
数据源自2016.6-2023.6年8年间全六级试卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight>考纲释义</highlight>
精选实考、考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2016-2023年51套试卷，包括阅读、听力、翻译等所有题型。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2016-2023年8年间全六级试卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

搜狗翻译拥有最终解释权。

examination_example.sentence: Office carpets collected more <highlight>bacteria</highlight> than elsewhere.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 办公室地毯比其他地方收集的细菌更多。

examination_example.sentence: There were more <highlight>bacteria</highlight> on sidewalks than in the home.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 人行道上的细菌比家里的多。

examination_example.sentence: They found that up to 421,000 units of <highlight>bacteria</highlight> can collect on the outside of a single shoe.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 他们发现，仅仅一只鞋的鞋面上就可以聚集多达42.1万个细菌单位。

disambiguation_list.sense_disambiguation: (系bacterium的复数形式)，泛指任何在动植物体中广泛传播的微生物细菌，其中有的对生命体无害，有的能导致传染病或严重疾病，如天花、霍乱等。
非正式用词, 指细菌或由病毒所引起的传染病。
微生物的俗称, 专指引起人体生命的病菌。
本义指在显微镜下才能见到的微生物, 现在多指引起疾病的细菌。

direction_info.description:
数据源自2016.6-2023.6年8年间全四级试卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight>考纲释义</highlight>
精选实考、考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2016-2023年51套试卷，包括阅读、听力、翻译等所有题型。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2016-2023年8年间试卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

搜狗翻译拥有最终解释权。

examination_example.sentence: <highlight>Bacteria</highlight> have been shown to live on cabin surfaces, so wash your hands frequently ．
examination_example.sentence_trans: 已有证据表明机舱表面存在细菌，所以要经常洗手。

examination_example.sentence: <highlight>Bacteria</highlight> are carried by various "media", which can include raw food, moist surfaces where <highlight>bacteria</highlight> have been left, our hands or skin and from coughing or sneezing (打喷嚏) .
examination_example.sentence_trans: 细菌通过各种“媒介”携带，包括生的食物、留下细菌的潮湿表面、我们的手或皮肤以及咳嗽或打喷嚏。

examination_example.sentence: <highlight>Bacteria</highlight> in these communities also have an enhanced resistance to sanitizes (清洁剂) and antibiotics compared to <highlight>bacteria</highlight> living on their own.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 相较于独自生存的细菌而言，这些群落中的细菌对于消毒水和抗生素的抵抗力也增强了。

examination_example.sentence: Bio film communities can harbor <highlight>bacteria</highlight> longer and are very difficult to clean.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 生物膜群落可以较长时间地滋生细菌，而且很难清洗。

examination_example.sentence: Clarke and her colleagues introduced <highlight>bacteria</highlight> to floor tiles (瓷砖) and then placed cookies on the tiles for varying times.
examination_example.sentence_trans: Clarke和她的同事将细菌引入地板砖，然后以不同的时间将饼干放在地板砖上。

examination_example.sentence: Five minutes after that, we placed either bacon or bread on the surface for 5, 30 or 60 seconds, and then measured the number of <highlight>bacteria</highlight> transferred to the food.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 五分钟后，我们将培根或面包放在表面上5秒、30秒或60秒，然后测量转移到食物上的细菌数量。

examination_example.sentence: For example, 10 <highlight>bacteria</highlight> or less of an especially deadly strain of <highlight>bacteria</highlight> can cause severe illness and death in people with compromised immune systems.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 例如，10个或更少的特别致命的细菌菌株，就能使免疫系统受损的人得重病和死亡。

examination_example.sentence: Hands, foods and utensils (器皿) can carry individual <highlight>bacteria</highlight> living in communities contained within a protective film.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 手、食物和器皿可以携带生活在保护膜中的单个细菌。

examination_example.sentence: If you have millions or more <highlight>bacteria</highlight> on a surface, 0.1% is still enough to make you sick.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 如果你的食物表面有数百万或更多的细菌，0.1%足以让你生病。

examination_example.sentence: It depends on just how many <highlight>bacteria</highlight> can make it from floor to food in a few seconds and just how dirty the floor is.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 这取决于几秒钟之内从地板到食物的细菌数量，以及地板的肮脏程度。

examination_example.sentence: It looks like what's at issue is much more how contaminated with <highlight>bacteria</highlight> that patch of floor happens to be.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 看起来问题更多的是在于那块地板被细菌污染的程度。

examination_example.sentence: the chance of these <highlight>bacteria</highlight> being on most surfaces is very low.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 这些细菌在大多数表面的几率非常低。

examination_example.sentence: The overall number of <highlight>bacteria</highlight> on the surface mattered more, and this decreased over time after the initial introduction.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 表面的细菌总数更重要，而且在最初引入后，随着时间的推移，细菌数量会减少。

examination_example.sentence: These microscopic layers of deposits containing <highlight>bacteria</highlight> are known as bio films and they are found on most surfaces and objects.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 这些含有细菌的微观沉积层被称为生物膜，它们存在于大多数表面和物体上。

examination_example.sentence: They reported <highlight>bacteria</highlight> were transferred from the tiles to the cookies within five seconds.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 他们的报告显示，细菌在5秒钟内从瓷砖转移到饼干上。

examination_example.sentence: To find out, we introduced <highlight>bacteria</highlight> to squares of tile, carpet or wood.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 为了找出答案，我们将细菌引入瓷砖、地毯或者木头中。

examination_example.sentence: The number of <highlight>bacteria</highlight> transferred to either kind of food didn't depend much on how long the food was in contact with the contaminated surface.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 转移到两种食物中的细菌数量与食物与受污染表面的接触时间长短没有太大的关系。

examination_example.sentence: We repeated this exact procedure after the <highlight>bacteria</highlight> had been on the surface for 2, 4, 8 and 24 hours.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 细菌在表面停留了2、4、8、24小时后，我们重复了这一步骤。

examination_example.sentence: We wanted to know if the length of time food is in contact with a contaminated surface affected the rate of transfer of <highlight>bacteria</highlight> to the food.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 我们想知道食物与受污染表面接触的时间长短是否会影响细菌向食物转移的速度。

examination_example.sentence: When a carpet was contaminated, less than 1% of the <highlight>bacteria</highlight> were transferred. But when the food was in contact with tile or wood, 45-70% of <highlight>bacteria</highlight> were.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 当地毯被污染时，只有不到1%的细菌被转移。但当食物与瓷砖或木头接触时，45-70%的细菌被转移了。

disambiguation_list.sense_disambiguation: (系bacterium的复数形式)，泛指任何在动植物体中广泛传播的微生物细菌，其中有的对生命体无害，有的能导致传染病或严重疾病，如天花、霍乱等。
非正式用词，指细菌或由病毒所引起的传染病。
微生物的俗称，专指引起人体生命的病菌。
本义指在显微镜下才能见到的微生物，现在多指引起疾病的细菌。

direction_info.description:
数据源自2015-2022年8年间全国卷和自主命题省市高考卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight> 考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2015-2022年全国卷高考试卷，包括阅读、完形、单选、填空、听力、改错、写作等所有题型。

<highlight> 考纲释义</highlight>
精选各省市考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2015-2022年8年间全国卷和自主命题省市高考卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

搜狗翻译拥有最终解释权。

examination_example.sentence: <highlight>Bacteria</highlight> are an annoying problem for astronauts.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 细菌对宇航员来说是个恼人的问题。

examination_example.sentence: For the past two years, Gordon's students have been studying ways to kill <highlight>bacteria</highlight> in zero gravity.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 在过去的两年里，戈登的学生们一直在研究在零重力下杀死细菌的方法。

disambiguation_list.sense_disambiguation: bacterium的复数形式，泛指任何在动植物体中广泛传播的微生物细菌，其中有的对生命体无害，有的能导致传染病或严重疾病，如天花、霍乱等。
非正式用词，指细菌或由病毒所引起的传染病。
微生物的俗称，专指引起人体生命的病菌。
本义指在显微镜下才能见到的微生物，现在多指引起疾病的细菌。
